title: BCCI President Jagmohan Dalmiya passes away
content:
Zee Media Bureau

New Delhi: The President of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Jagmohan Dalmiya has passed away on Sunday evening at KM Birla hospital in Kolkata. He was 75. The BCCI boss had suffered heart attack on Thursday and was under observation after undergoing a heart surgery.

Regarded as one of the greatest Indian sports administrators, Dalmiya became the BCCI president for a second stint in March this year, taking over from N Srinivasan. But with deteriorating health, the Kolkata-based businessman had been keeping away from the board meetings except for the very important ones.

Dalmiya had been president of the Interntional Cricket Council, and held different offices in the Indian cricket board, and occupied top posts in the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) in a career that began in 1979.
